results.title: The Incised image
results.brief_description: A film on the work of Charles Lloyd showing in detail the dry-point technique of etching and the possibilities of one-plate colour printing which he studied at Atelier 17 in Paris. Culminates in an animated sequence interpreting his statement - “each print is an adventure, a little journey of discovery”. The commentary is edited from his recorded discussions.

results.title: In search of myself
results.brief_description: Considers the conflicts encountered by the people of the emerging nations who want to utilise the best aspects of technologically advanced societies but also want their progress to be uniquely African in nature. Young Nigerian authors, artists and musicians discuss their opinions and experiences.

results.title: In one lifetime
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Political development in Papua New Guinea as seen through the eyes of Simon Kaumi, the Deputy Chief Electoral Officer. The progress he has seen in one lifetime includes the work of the Local Government Councils in replacing the traditional system and the 1968 House of Assembly election.

results.title: Immigration law: a delicate balance
results.creator_credit: Arnie Gelbart, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The immigration law, and its enforcement, are examined in this documentary. It is a difficult exercise in which objective and non discriminatory criteria are applied in the screening of each prospective new Canadian. Case histories illustrate various aspects of this law.

results.title: The Immigrant experience: the long long journey
results.creator_credit: Joan Micklin Silver, Linda Gottlieb and Omaha-Orange Films
results.brief_description: Focuses on the problems and dreams of new immigrants in America by telling about an uprooted Polish family. Shows how they lived at the beginning of the 20th century and includes interviews with the grandfather today as he reveals his contentment with improved opportunities for his grandchildren.

results.title: Imagination at work
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how to overcome the most common barriers to individual creative thinking - perceptual, cultural and emotional - and the factors which contribute to creative ability - sensitivity, fluency, flexibility and originality.

results.title: I'm ready to learn
results.creator_credit: Henry Lewes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Pre-school education in Australia is examined. How important is pre-school education? Does a child really learn anything - or is it just a baby-sitting service, or a playtime? What kind of pre-school education is available and what are the requirements of an adequate pre-school education? How many children have a chance to receive this type of education and what happens to those who miss out on this opportunity?

results.title: If trees can fly
results.brief_description: A visual essay on the random thoughts of two 10-year old children as they witness nature unfolding - bird eggs hatching, swans preening themselves and birds in flight. Through the fantasies they create, they relate how they think about birth, death and life.
results.description: A visual essay on the random thoughts of two 10-year old children as they witness nature unfolding - bird eggs hatching, swans preening themselves and birds in flight. Through the fantasies they create, they relate how they think about birth, death and life.

results.title: ICI la France: L'heritage de Napoleon
results.creator_credit: Mary Glasgow, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: French language training film - all dialogue is in French. A visit to Prince Murat, a descendant of Napoleon, who describes Napoleon’s activities as an administrator, and creator of the Civil Code and the Legion d’Honneur. He also founded a boarding school at St Denis for daughters of members of the Legion d’Honneur. A visit to this school shows how the traditions established by Napoleon are still being maintained.
